newsitem.title: INDIA: India's RBI names money market panel members.
newsitem.headline: India's RBI names money market panel members.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday announced the names of members of a proposed panel to advise the central bank on the development of money markets.
The panel will be chaired by Y.V. Reddy, RBI deputy governor, and Y.S.R. Sarma, another RBI official, will be the committee secretary, RBI said in a statement.

The committee members include M.G. Bhide, managing director of the State Bank of India; Lalita Gupte, deputy managing director of term-lender ICICI; Hemendra Kothari, chairman of DSP Merrill Lynch Ltd.; R.H. Patil, managing director of the National Stock Exchange; J.D. Pullen, CEO of Hongkong Bank; Basudeb Sen, chief general manager of the Unit Trust of India; Ganti Subrahmanyam, of the National Institute of Bank Management; and Finance Ministry official Arvind Virmani.
RBI executive directors V. Subrahmanyam and A. Vasudevan will be special invitees on the panel, RBI said.

The panel's terms of reference include suggesting measures to strengthen the role of the call money market in the financial system, with reference to participants, instruments and the institutional arrangements to develop the call money market.

It will advise on measures to ensure the orderly functioning of the call money market including in particular, payment and settlement systems, implications of reserve requirements on the banking system, money supply and the term money market.

RBI said the panel will also suggest meaures for developing secondary market for money market instruments, to assess and advise on the evolving and desirable linkages between the money, foreign exchange, government securities and capital markets..
It may also advise on specific issues referred to it by RBI and to examine other issues having a bearing on the development of the money market.
